rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Naumoff is a funny guy and an excellent professor. His guidelines can be confusing and it can be hard to tell whether he's joking or just being himself, but this won't affect your grade. For some unknown reason, he hates Neil Patrick Harris. He gives good feedback and makes you say something nice about everyone's stories, before criticizing them.

Naumoff is great, very entertaining guy. But I think recently he's caved into other people's desires that he be nicer which is terrible! If you take this course, encourage him to be brutal because otherwise you will not learn anything. I don't think he's quite gotten how to be nice and critical at the same time. Still an incredibly fun course!

Not at all a good creative writing teacher. Likes works that are basically copies of his own style, and everything else he has little to no helpful input on. Has a sour demeanor. Also has a narrow view on what constitutes "good writing"--one of those types who's too lost in academia to have any connection to the world outside.

Seriously, how can a writing professor be TOO brutally honest?  Naumoff is awesome.  He will make sure you know what you're doing right, and he makes sure you know what you're doing wrong.  It's really important to him that you find your own voice, and he'll help you do that, too.  Also, unlike a lot of cw profs, he supports avant-garde material.

I took intro to fiction writing with him. He's pretty brutally honest bordering on mean sometimes, but overall I enjoyed the class. He teaches round-robin style so basically you get a lot of "guided" peer input. Definitely recommend course, maybe not professor.
